name: Sofitel New York

reviews.text: Let's face it, New York City hotels are very expensive. We were able to stay in October at the Sofitel New York, in a suite, for about the cost of staying in a basic room in many of the other NYC hotels. Our suite was on the top floor of the hotel. It was spacious, with complimentary boxes of chocolate and bottles of water daily, turndown service, a deep, sunken tub and high end bath amenities. The bed was a little too soft for our tastes--with its deep down topper, but otherwise everything about the room was perfect.
reviews.title: Sofitel New York--Great Stay for the Money

likes.liked: — The concierge staff and how helpful they were; also the location of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real complaint I have is that one morning something happened to the hot water and it took 40 minutes before we could shower (before the problem was fixed and hot water was available again.)
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The front desk staff, the three concierges we dealt with, the housekeeping staff--all were friendly and first rate. Go to the concierge for lunch/dinner recommendations. We did a couple of times and ate some of the best food ever. We strongly recommend the Osteria al Doge, which the concierge recommended. Though it is pricey, it has the best Italian food.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gaby bar, in the Sofitel, serves delicious drinks and has quick food service. The Gaby restaurant, on the other hand, has good food, but the service was lacking and the place had a lot of empty tables on the Thursday night we were there.
reviews.title: Peace and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our next stay to New York, we will definitely stay at the Sofitel once again.
reviews.title: Chicago guests thinks Sofitel NY is one of the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked part of our honeymoon to stay at Sofitel NY after careful research on trip advisor and being happy with the advice given on the sight on previous occasions. All i can say is some of the people who have written reviews must either have different expectations to me or some of the other hotels in NYC are really poor.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in NYC? Don't think so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also stayed at the Sofitel Chicago during our trip and the difference was night and day.
reviews.title: Brilliant place - great location, service and view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Excellent service best for Broadway

reviews.text: - Location can't be faulted - location right at the heart of midtown within walking distance of most things.
reviews.title: Perfectly Fabulous!!!

reviews.text: - Nice room (we had a suite on the 27th Floor) with awesome views of Rockafellar, Empire State and Chrysler buildings. Nice comfy bed and plenty of room.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Sofitel twice in the last 2 years and am going again this May. It's a great hotel, central, quiet, lovely rooms and really nice big bathrooms. I would recommend it to anyone. It may be a little pricey but you get what you pay for. The Red Flame Diner is the best place for breakfast that we have come across. Even dinner was nice there. Big portions so take your appetite with you.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for New York, Great Rooms & Amenities

likes.liked: — Big clean rooms with lovely bathrooms
likes.disliked: — Bit expensive but hey so is NY

reviews.title: 100% satisfaction
reviews.text: We arrived via the new airline Silverjet to Newark, our only concerns in this direction was flying from Luton or we should say arriving back to the U.K. too longer quees at immigration took nearly an hour! However the airline was superb. Greeted at Newark with snow and -6 temp. Arrived at Sofitel to a very warm welcome, nothing too much trouble. We had a suite on 26th floor and room was immaculate, could not be faulted. The bed was superb only trouble was getting out of such a comfortable experience! We had no complaints apart from not having a spa, we ended up at the 5 star Peninsula, I believe the Sofitel New York could benefit from this amenity. Next time we go in the Spring time, when its a bit warmer!

reviews.title: More than expected
reviews.text: Pour un premier séjour à NYC, le Sofitel est parfaitement situé, tres tres bonne localisation. Le seul soucis etait le tarif en vigueur mais en plein Fashion Week, je me suis estimé heureux de pouvoir booker non pas une chambre (No Vacancy) mais une suite : Atmosphere Art Déco, moelleux du lit extraordinaire, Staff tres serviable et efficace, surtout la reception. Au fait pour information à transmettre au Concierge, Tie & Jacket au 21 Club sont obligatoires ! Une tres bonne adresse (les deux ;-) ) à recommander sans hesitation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoy your Stay.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my first trip to NYC and I booked this hotel due its location...and for this reason I wasn't disappointed. It's in fab location, between 5th and 6th and ideal for a first time visitor to the big apple. The room was nothing special, clean etc. but somewhat characterless. The bar was really cool but the fresh flowers throughout the lobby/reception area were truly amazing...especially the peony roses, Wow! I got a good deal on the hotel website so I was happy that I got value for money as well.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is NBR1, really central and walking distance to everything. Would be Stay here again unfortunately not.
reviews.title: Location is the best!

reviews.text: The sleeping was really hard, we could not get comfy in the bed, the quilts etc we changed the configuration around as we spent 7 Nights here. But truly we just could not get asleep.
reviews.title: Centrally located and nice room
Another great stay
reviews.text: The staff were really great in the restaurant and bar, and all in all Service was good.

reviews.title: Perfect location, a touch of class with modern style
reviews.text: We are Platinum AClub holders and the Staff did acknowledge this and upgraded our room for the Stay.

My husband and I stayed in New York for 5 nights at the Sofitel. The welcoming staff was not overly friendly but that was okay. We loved the entrance hall and the whole appearence of the hotel. The room was very nice and clean not very spacious but absolutely spotless ( I was looking for the spots but could not find any). Try to get a high floor as the views are fantastic day and night.
reviews.title: Well deserved award

reviews.text: For some odd reason we had a crib in our room which we never requested. After several apologies the staff removed the crib. One bulb in the bathroom had to be replaced I think they did it within a few minutes after we reported it. Very fast and efficient service.
reviews.title: Wonderfu Hotel!!!!

reviews.text: The location is also absolutely fantastic you can walk everywhere and you are there in the middle of time square within 3 minutes walk. The good thing is although the hotel is so central it is still very quite and peaceful.
reviews.title: PURE LUXURY

reviews.text: For breakfast we recommend the red flame dinner as it has the best breakfast ever.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: I generally do not like hotels but this one is very superb and I would recommend it to everyone.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: Great location; great rooms and fabulous service. We loved the hotel. Albert at the front desk was extremely knowledgable and helpful.

reviews.title: High class hotel
reviews.text: All reviews true. Really lovely quality hotel, charming and efficient service (I stayed in three different hotels in New York for one trip and this was the only one I didn't have to queue to check in/ out). Hotel also let me have a free late check out. Room was lovely, even had a great view. So it's not cheap, but where in New York is?

reviews.title: It is true!
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights at the Sofitel New York , 27 August 2005 onward .
Chose the hotel based on the reviews on this website and we were not
reviews.title: Stylish, well situated Manhattan hotel.

reviews.text: wrong to do so . The service was first class in terms of concierge , front desk , room service & chamber maids . We did not use the Gaby restaurant electing to take breakfast at the Red Flame £25 for 4 including tip & eating out in the evening. The location is superb with Times Square, Central Station , 5th Avenue all within a 10 minute walk , truly remarkable .
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Location and The BEDS, OH THE BEDS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say I really loved this hotel, from the minute I arrived I felt totally relaxed. The staff at the reception were really nice and i was very impressed with the room. The bathroom especially was really really nice, seperate large bath and shower. On our last day when we were storing our luggage the guy at the front door offered to have a car there for us on when we got back to bring us to the airport. We were well impressed when the car turned out to be a limo at no extra charge. Location is spot on, 5 minute walk from everything you wanna see. Would definite recommend, myself and my boyfriend loved it.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: Great location, service, room, staff.
reviews.title: Good all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reasonable price for service provided, particularly in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Excellency!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely quiet, despite very central location.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware minibar - a bottle of Evian at 15$ seems like a ripoff.
reviews.title: Simply THE BEST

likes.liked: — every detail provided by the sofitel that makes you feel special

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel for 2 nights, upon arrival, we were instantly greeted by the bellman, directed to check in and able to check in at 8 in the morning. the staff is the friendliest staff I have come across, not only in New York, but anywhere!!!
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice, large bathroom, clean tub, shower, magnifying mirror, tv speaker and phone in bathroom, marble.
reviews.title: Slightly Disappointed
Simply the Best!!
reviews.text: the room was very comfortable, ironing board and iron, safe, mini bar, etc. Quick elevators, nice comfortable lobby with internet access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had absolutely no problems. We were even able to extend our check out time!!
reviews.title: What a welcome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel is in a great location on 44th St. 2 blocks from the hubbub of Times Square, but the street is very quiet.
reviews.title: Great Value $269 Weekend Internet Rate

likes.liked: — Location, $269 price and quality of the guest rooms

reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned after 5 nights in New Yawk(sic). Again, like so many, we went on the advice of Tripadvisor users and can only say it was fantastic. A truly fantastic experience, lots of friendly, knowledgable staff with good restaurant advice; spotless room - yes, we liked the turn down service too! Location is spot on - we are keen walkers and we could head uptown or down towards Battery Park from here, and there was so much nearby as well. We are already planning our next visit and will be absolutely gutted if we can't return to this hotel...
reviews.title: Yet another top marks
Loved the Sofitel
reviews.text: A special mention should also go to the Red Flame diner in West 44th St. - we used this every day for breakfast - great value and a true American style diner - loved it!

We just returned from a weekend (4/1/05) at the Sofitel which we chose because of TripAdvisor, and like every other review we were not disappointed. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was friendly. Our room was very nice, clean, comfortable bed, not too small, nice view, clean bathroom with marble vanity. The location of the hotel was excellent. Parking across the street was $ 28.00 - we saw the Producer's which was on the same street so we just walked there and to Carmine's for dinner. Breakfast a few doors down at the Red Flame like the reviews recommended. We signed up for the Sofitel Priileged Guest Card and got 4:00 pm checkout which was helpful. It was a great weekend thanks to Tripadvisor!
reviews.title: Truly Magnificent
Perfect-believe the hype
reviews.text: I booked the Sofitel based (after exhaustive research) on the reviews here, and it really does deserve the reputation it's earned here. This review applies to a suite - I splashed out this one time as it was a special occasion. Good accomodation is something I place great importance on - it's great to just crash out sometimes and watch a movie for a few hours - the Sofitel surpassed this expectation in every measurable sense.

Rooms are absolutely luxurious - they look identical to the pictures on their site (something that's very rare these days). Attention to detail is extraordinary; mini Hi-fi, CD clock radio, travel adapter in room, bathrobes, slippers, candle in bathroom (along a little box with a nail file, shower cap and some mints), separate shower, silk coat hangers; there was even an umbrella provided in the closet.
reviews.title: Sorry to be unoriginal but.....

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights (May 20-23, '06). We paid $302.35 each night including taxes thru Expedia when booked with our airfare. I have seen better and I have seeen worse rates....
reviews.title: Sofitel New York - ASK for extras!

reviews.text: Another guest did the following which I think are excellent ideas- I didn't read thoroughly enough though to do this for our visit- I hope you do....:
reviews.title: SOFITEL HOTEL NYC - Really good hotel - highly recommend ! ! !
Absolute World Class
reviews.text: -emailed the hotel prior to arrival to confirm booking and request a room with a good view

reviews.title: An unusually quiet NYC hotel
reviews.text: - also mentioned that it as a special trip for both

reviews.title: Faultless
reviews.text: -On arrival they were given

Booked this hotel earlier in the year when we decided to treat ourselves to a family trip to New York just before Christmas. Couldn't fault anything, from the friendliness of the all the staff to the well equipped bedrooms, we even had a nice deep bath (unlike the usual "glorified shower tray" that pass for baths in USA hotels). Nicely situated in the Midtown area, it's easy to get many of the main attractions
reviews.title: Fab hotel for a Pre Christmas trip to the big apple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is only 2 blocks from Times Square in one direction and 2 blocks from Grand Central Station in the other. From my experience staying in NYC, this room was very spacious, it was no different than Sofitel's that I have stayed at in Chicago and Philly. There was a nice little sitting area close to the window with 2 chairs and a table and the bathroom was great with plenty of counter space and room for all the stuff you have to bring when you travel. The staff was very friendly and when I requested extra towels they were at the door litterally 10 minutes later. The hotel was very clean and the beds were, as always with Sofitel, plush and comfy!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay near Times Square and Transit in NYC and I will definitely be staying there again!!
reviews.title: Spacious Room Close to Times Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the first time my wife and I have ever stayed at a Sofitel hotel and it was one of the best places we have ever stayed in over 25 years of travelling. All the employees in every area of the hotel were excellent. Always available to help as needed and always willing to go above and beyond.
reviews.title: Par Excellence ...

reviews.text: We had a king room that was of good size, compared to other rooms in national hotel chains around New York city. The decor is European, the bar and lounge area is inviting yet it can be quiet enough for an after business drink to wind down your day.
reviews.title: Wedding anniversary celebration

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel in September 2002 for 2 days and July 2004 for 4 days. Good location, as it's slightly off Times Square to avoid the hussle and tourists.
reviews.title: Excellent service, but needs R&M
Very impressed with the Sofitel
reviews.text: Service is excellent. Staff were courteous and fast. What surprised me, however, is the condition of the hotel. While still in decent shape, repair and maintenance clearly needs to be done during my stay in 2004. The standing shower units are kept watertight via a rubber seal. This seal was torn in parts of the shower, resulting in some water being sprayed onto the bathroom floor. I also noted some graffiti on the bathroom wall - minor problems, but something that a first class hotel should deal with.

reviews.title: Almost lived up to expectations
reviews.text: Despite the hotel's minor imperfections, I find that I will still highly recommend this hotel, only if the price is right. Given the amount of selection available in NY, you can't go wrong with the Sofitel, but it may not be the best deal around.

We just spent 5 nights at the Sofitel and were very happy with what we found. Unfortunately, our request for a high room via the web agent didn't get to the hotel and we ended up with a room on the 11th floor which didn't offer the best view in the world. However, this wasn't the hotel's fault. The hotel has 29 floors so there may have been other rooms which afforded a better view.
reviews.title: Soiftel - C'est Bon!
Amazing hotel!
reviews.text: The room was very well equipped and modern with plenty of room. It was also immaculately clean which is always a bonus. The tv offered direct internet access, cd request facility as well as the usual pay per view for all the latest movies. The bathroom had a bath as well as a separate shower and was quite spacious. No coffee making available though. We never used the turn-down service although it was available.
The room was immaculate every day and the turn-down service superb. The weather forecast and bottles of evian very nice touches.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Tripadvisor saves the day again!
reviews.text: Check-out was quick and efficient and the doorman kindy arranged a fabulous car to the airport for us.

reviews.title: tres tres magnifique !!.
reviews.text: Can't imagine staying anywhere else if returning to New York - if you have a stay at the Sofitel booked be very excited and if not, do not be afraid to book this exellently located hotel. It was certainly worth every penny we paid.
Booked the Sofitel for 5 nights based on Tripadvisor reviews. Lived up to expectations. Excellent location, room, bathroom! and food. Will use again.
reviews.title: Sara Jo and Rosy say ...Magnifique!!

reviews.text: We just came back from a 2 night stay at Sofitel.It was great.Very centrally located.A short walk to times square or fifth ave.
reviews.title: Elegant and warm
Excellent Location - Great Hotel
reviews.text: Everyone was very french..but very friendly.Room service was quick, front desk was quick.

The rooms are spotlessly clean.Housekeepers were lovely.But, the bed is beyond good it is heavenly!They just engulf you in feathers from the featherbed to the comforter and pillows.It is like sleeping on a cloud.
reviews.title: ok, but not number 1

reviews.text: Fresh flowers in the bathroom which is all marble.
reviews.title: mad about this place

reviews.text: I don't have a bad word to say about Sofitel
reviews.title: Absolutely Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible beds - can't say enough about them - great pillows and soft comforter - this in its own gives this place a five out of five. Location is very good - close to Times Square (not that you'd want to spend time around there) but far enough to get away from that madness. The staff were all very friendly, always greeting us several times as we entered and left the Hotel. Had room service one night - excellent hamburgers. My only complaint would be that the bathtubs were very shallow - not worth having a good soak. Other than that would 100% stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Best beds ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived we loved our stay at this hotel, the only thing that upset me was that we were in New York and spent very little time at the excellent hotel. Everything thing we asked for we got, service was excellent, room was great, bed was brilliant Bathroom and particluarly the shower was Fab. Got what i thought was a good deal through Expedia as we booked flights as well. Its was a bit more expensive than some but way cheaper than lots as well,
reviews.title: superb hotel

likes.liked: — Made to feel special by staff

reviews.text: All in all we thought the hotel was excellent
reviews.title: Loved the Sofitel NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my 16 year old daughter to New York for a shopping and Theatre 5 day treat. The Sofitel was brilliant- great staff- fax with GCSE results slid effortlessly under the door at 5.00am, helpful friendly staff, and a fantastic location - quiet so you could sleep yet a short walk to Times Square - talking of sleep, quite simply the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in!!!
reviews.title: Great location but still peaceful

reviews.text: All In all a perfect stay- Thank-you
reviews.title: Most AWESOME Hotel in NYC!!!

reviews.text: The Sofitel was a nice, clean hotel in NYC, but very pricey. Rooms are modern and clean with large bathrooms and nice TV's. We got a room on the 21st floor with a good view of the city. The bed and linens were very comfy. The lobby's not much to look at and seems worn. The best thing about the hotel is the location, 2 blocks from almost everything. Staff was friendly, although the concierge could have been a bit more helpful. Overall a good experience with no real complaints. The Red Flame restaurant right down the street is a good place for breakfast at a reasonable price. Would stay again if ever in NYC again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just finished our weekend getaway at the Sofitel and it was average. Obiviously the room was small. We booked a luxury king room on the 16th floor. At night you can here the water running down from the upper floors everytime someone used the bathroom. The shower had a temperature lock on it so that you can't turn the water any hotter. There is only one sink with horrible water control. The view was terrible. The pillows were awful. The bed is comfortable. No one so far has mentioned that parking is $50.00 per night with a $45 fee for retrieving your car (in addition). The location is very good and close to most destinations. We did not eat at the hotel but we did eat at Mesa Grill (also average) and Koi (very good). We also saw Wicked (highly recommended).
reviews.title: Average at Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a little background this will be my fifth consecutive stay at the Sofitel in New York City. For the past five years my wife and I have stayed at the hotel because of the location, charm, and service and quality of rooms. The first two years (reviews posted) the service was impeccable and without question the staff would ensure every request was met.
reviews.title: 5th Stay at the Sofitel

likes.disliked: — Room Condition, Staff Response to concerns

reviews.text: Last year (2007) there was a noticeable decline in the hotel (rugs worn, walls slightly damaged) but I guess that is expected. The limo forgot to pick us up at the airport and I had to call 4-5 times to finally have a car pick us up. In all fairness this was not the hotels fault but the car company they were using at the time.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location!

reviews.text: Well, sadly this year will most likely be our last at the Sofitel. The service has further digressed and the rooms are starting to show their age. We had a problem with the air conditioner vent (rattling) that could not be resolved, someone was smoking cigars on the floor, and we were told the odor would go away in time. But here is the thing that will make me look at another hotel next year. On our second day of a four day stay we came back to the room after a day in the city to find the room had been somewhat cleaned, but the pillows had no pillow cases, no duvet and half the towels were missing.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with european style, but lacking a certain something.

reviews.text: My husband and I visit New York several times a year to visit our daughter. We stay in different hotels every time we go. This time we stayed at the Sofitel and although it was over and above what we would normally pay, it was worth every single cent. The staff are among the best we have encountered anywhere. Just walking through the lobby you know you are in for something very special. We had booked a "Superior" room, which is the cheapest, but there was nothing cheap about this room. The bed was the most comfortable we have slept in. The decor was understated elegance. The bathroom was amazing, not only a bath with shower, but an extremely large walk-in shower, enough for at least four people to shower at the same time! Only ever staying in 31/2 or 4 star hotels it is very unusual for "room only" hotels to have a turn down service at night. Not only were the beds turned down, but all the towels changed as well. They also supply big fluffy robes and slippers.....what more can you ask for. They also leave a note of what the weather will be like the next day....wow. Money permitting, we will definitely stay at the Sofitel again. All this and a five minute walk to Times Square.
reviews.title: Loved Sofitel

reviews.text: Your within a stroll from all what you love about NYC if that is theatre, shopping and people when you stay at The Sofitel. Central Park, the Empire State Building, the Library, 5thAvenue, MOMA although that was a contemporary disappointment. The hotel rooms were wonderfully quiet from the horn-blowing conversations of NYC. Timing and lineups of TKTS made a drop in to Spamelot theatre necessary and rewarding. Orchestra seats Thurs pm. Monty Python takes a shot at all. Hilarious. No tax on clothes, Macy discounts for out of town plus credit card app, Labour Day sales, the place was jammed. Chez Josephine great piano, good bistro food. Le Train Blue at Bloomies a Restaurant Week treat. You won't have issues with the Sofitel if you do it could only be that everyone wants to stay there. We found it a great way to start and end your New York day and BUZZ!!!
reviews.title: If you love NYC, the theatre but not the noise...

reviews.text: I had been reading all reviews before booking a Deluxe Queen Room at the Sofitel. I was not disappointed at all !
reviews.title: Really great hotel !

reviews.text: Before checking in, I had sent an e-mail to the hotel requesting for a high floor room and a late check-out. Indeed, the (free) Sofitel Privilège Card offers this late check-out as part of the package. In addition, I had mentionned my birthday at that time.
reviews.title: This is an excellent hotel in a great location

reviews.text: What we got in return:
reviews.title: We loved it!!
Five-star quality at three-star prices
reviews.text: We were drawn to the Sofitel because of its top ranking here at TripAdvisor, then the low rate we found at Hotels ($161/night) clinched it. And we were not disappointed. The room wasn't large, but it did seem luxurious, with lots of nice extras: bathrobe, slippers, CD player, large framed photographs from New York and Paris on the wall. The bathroom was exceptional with its marble sink, glass shower plus separate bathtub. The TV speaker in the bathroom was a little odd, but what the heck. Bed wasn't the most comfortable, but there were plenty of pillows. As others have mentioned, we did receive a tiny complimentary bottle of Evian water each night with the bed turn-down service, but not the fresh bud that I had read about in a previous posting. Location was great, just a couple of blocks from Times Square. Check-in was very quick, friendly and easy. We will definitely be returning to the Sofitel.

My wife and I are what you might call 'High Maintenance' in fact our standard line when getting to the check-in desk is 'give us the key to the third room first!' however this hotel practically went all the way to meeting our very exacting standards - unprecedented!
reviews.title: C'est formidable!
great location, great service
reviews.text: I think the charming girl at the front desk got our measure straight away and when my wife requested a king room on a high floor (as opposed to a queen room on a low floor) she suggested that we have a look at 2 rooms that she had available - excellent!

reviews.title: Well done Tripadvisor
reviews.text: When we decided on our lovely king room my wife went through her 'is it worthy?' hotel room check;

reviews.title: Loved the Sofitel hotel
reviews.text: spacious room - check, luxury fittings - check, good quality bed linen-check, luxury marble bathroom with quality toiletries - check, fluffy bathrobe and slippers - check. It was all there and more e.g. flowers in the room and complimentary Evian water.

reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay
reviews.text: I stayed at Sofitel for a business trip in April and over the Volcano Ash Cloud disruption period. The hotel staff were very understanding and helpful. They were very flexible where my stay was easily extended and check out time was also very flexible.

reviews.title: Wonderful service
reviews.text: On arrival at check in, i requested to switched my room from 5th floor to higher floors. The staff reviewed the situation and moved me to 21st floor. Happy :)

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: Room, big enough bed for me, nice spacious bathroom with great designer products. I needed a bath to calm me down over the depressing news of flight cancellation and uncertainty of when i will be able to go home!

reviews.title: Location is perfect
reviews.text: Internet acess, there are 3 pcs in the lobby but as you can imagine how busy it got where everyone was trying to rebook flights but again, good facility to have.

reviews.title: Great location, Great Staff, Wonderful Stay!
reviews.text: Gym, i used the gym couple of times and it was well equipped.

We stayed here for 3 nights in December 2012. Hotel located in between Times Square and 5th avenue on 44th street. Easy walking to 3 subway stations within 2 blocks. Hotel room itself was average with scratches on the wall and peeling wallpaper in a few spots. Bed was soft and clean with warm bedding. Bose Wave radio on the nightstand that our traveling partners could hear through the wall. Bathroom was comfortable and amazing with everything you could need. I like quiet and we didn't hear any other guests on the hall or doors slamming up and down the hall. Elevators were fast, never waited more than 20 seconds going up or down from the 14th floor. Staff at desk, concierge, and doormen were helpful and professional. The weekend we went was cold and rainy so the free umbrellas helped. Overall, would stay there again. It's midtown NYC so expect to pay $$$.
reviews.title: Great location, quiet, attentive staff
Comfortable room and great location
reviews.text: Chose this hotel based on the quality expected from the Sofitel brand and its location, which is excellent, being convenient for Times Square, Grand Central Station, Radio City, 5th Ave. Our room, on the 18th floor was a little oasis from the hustle and bustle of the New York streets being very quiet, even though close to the lift. The room was a good size and the bathroom had a separate bath and shower with. Wifi was complimentary and reliable.

I stayed here for 5 nights with my five year-old son in November. It was just after Sandy had hit, and I had booked another hotel in SoHo initially, but cancelled and booked the Sofitel kinda last minute.
reviews.title: Great location, average hotel with really good croissants
Not as good as Sofitel Paris
reviews.text: The room was good, but still nothing special for that category of hotel. Everything was working, the bed was very very comfy, everything was clean. But still, we could hear the elevator from our room and TVs from adjoining rooms.
Breakfast was very good (beware! huge portions!), a la carte and the croissants very heavenly. They have a kids menu and some crayons etc in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Happy Thnaksgiving

reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location is perfect, within walking distance of all major mid-town sites. It's the best hotel on a block where there are several hotels to choose from like the Algonquin, the Mansfield, and the City Club. Also it's on a block with some great eating establishments, including DB Bistro, Kellari Taverna, Triomphe and the famous Blue Bar. What sets the hotel apart is large sleeping rooms and bathrooms, great service and fabulous food (the croissants are freshly made each morning!). The atmosphere is not too trendy (like the "W") or stuffy like the St. Regis. It's very professional without feeling too corporate.
reviews.title: Make It Your Place In Mid-Town

likes.disliked: — During my stay the business center was being remodelled. That should be done soon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 Nights 18/19/20th April 2006 we came over from Ireland to get married on 19th and we had the best time ever ! This hotel is PERFECT ! cant believe it is not a 5*.
reviews.title: Excellent, Fabulous, Amazing, Best Hotel in the World !

likes.liked: — our room upgrade to a gorgrous suite for our Wedding and the staff are fabulous !

reviews.text: We chose the hotel because of the amazing reviews and it definitely lives up to them tenfold ! The staff are absolutely amazing ! so nice and friendly and would go totally out of their way to help you (The lady on the reception desk was absolutely brilliant) Rooms are gorgeous and bed is Fabulous !
reviews.title: Large and Comfortable Room

reviews.text: We checked in and were trying to organise somewhere for our 26 Wedding guests from Ireland to meet on the morning of our Wedding (for which the lobby was perfect, lots of lovely seating area) and when they heard we were getting married they gave us an upgrade from a Queen room to a King, the lady said they would have given us a suite but they had none available that day, but if we left all our luggage ready the next day they would move us when we were at our Wedding ! we couldn’t believe it !
reviews.title: Cozy, clean, lovely

likes.disliked: — rooms a bit smal, but it is NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we returned back that Night after our Wedding they had moved rooms for us and the Room was completely and utterly UNBELIEVABLE ! firstly there was a bottle of champagne and a card from the staff and strawberries dipped in chocolate waiting for us which was beautiful ! such a lovely touch !
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I booked the Sofitel for our anniversary of meeting. We signed up for the hotels privlege card prior to booking which was free and enabled us to get a great deal on a suite and also late check out. All the staff were very friendly especially the turn down service, a chinese lady who was always happy and full of beans! The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in!!!!! It was -15 when we were in New York so we didn't venture out to much in the evening so room service was order of the day, it was excellent! lots of choice, always prompt and very tasty. I think the only thing I would complain about would be there were no tea & coffee facilities in the room which meant ringing room service every morning and at $18 for a pot of tea and coffee was an unexpected expense. If you're anything like me I need a coffee to go downstairs to get a coffee!! Apart from that a great place to stay. The Red Flame dinner four doors down from the hotel is also better value than the hotel breakfast.
reviews.title: Wow! What a bed.

reviews.text: Me and three of my girlfriends stayed at the Sofitel Feb.23-25 2007. We found a great deal on hotwire.The hotel had some of the best service that I have ever experiences. At check in we found VIvian to be very helpful. She informed us of all the amenities the hotel had to offer, such as the restaurant, souvenir shop, and the computers in the waiting area. The bedrooms at the hotel were smaller than expected, but who cares the room were neat and clean and enough room for 2 adults. The bathroom were very clean and spacious. Both the bedroom and bathroom were modern was very well kept. When trying to find a restaurant or something in particular Daniel, the concierge, was the most helpful. On our first night he recommended that we eat at Bond 45, an Italian restaurant. He took the time to make reservations for us, and the food was great. This was the routine the entire time we were there. However we ventured out one day with out his advice and we regretted it. We went to Fridays on 5th Ave., the service was terrible. The location was great. It was not in the center of time square, however time square was not that far. Maybe a block walk. Overall I have nothing but postive things to say about the service and value of the Sofitel. I would defintely recommend this hotel to others and I will be staying there in the future.
reviews.title: wonderful service for wonderful hotel
Five very cold nights in NYC, Feb 07.
reviews.text: Five very cold nights in NYC, Feb 07.

reviews.title: Pleasantly satisfied!
reviews.text: The Sofitel was everything we wanted and delivered everything it said it would. The room was very big and all modern, clean and in good condition. The bathroom was great and again modern and clean. The beds have been well documented by other reveiwers and I agree with them, great sleep.
The location, it's right there in the middle of everything but down a street that is quiet. There is a breakfast place on the same block that is very NYC and a fraction of the hotel breakfast cost.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights and the hotel was nice especially for a big city location. It is ideally situated. We got breakfast included and that is a bonus as it does work out expensive at nice hotels. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Can recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room
reviews.title: Lives up to all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Hotwire 4 star rating was well deserved for this Sofitel.
reviews.title: Perfect and the comfiest bed ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Staff was fast, efficiant and curdious.
reviews.title: Just right.
nothing but the best
reviews.text: -decor was on the edge of opulant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in late September 2009. The hotel is extremely luxurious and is extremely well located between 5th and 6th Avenues. Our bedroom was large by New York hotel standards and it was one of the most comfortable hotel rooms I have stayed in. It is a 5 minute stroll to Times Square and proabale the same to Central Park. The Red Flame Diner a few doors up from the hotel does excellent food and is a great spot for breakfast. Overall we cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Having stayed in a good number of hotels in New York City, this is by far the best and I will have no hesitation in staying here again. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Greeted by very friendly and professional staff upon arrival,quickest check in ever,hotel is in a great loacation,close to Grand central station,Times Square,Rockefeller,3 block walk to Central Park.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are of nice size and lovely plush clean bathrooms,one of the niceset rooms we have stayed in New York,the view was of office buildings and was the only negative i have of my experience,but we spent all day marching around Manhattan so we were not too disapointed.
reviews.title: Honeymoon In NY-The Manhattan Beginning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only went in the bar to have a drink so i cant review the restaurant,but the whole bar area had a lovely french feel to it and was modern,i did find the prices a bit steep but this is New York.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews

reviews.text: The concierge was very helpfull,waiting at the front desk only too happy to help,we definately recomend this hotel
reviews.title: Difficult to fault it

reviews.text: I've just returned from a couple of nights in the Sofitel, New York. I'd done my research when looking around for a hotel and the good reviews on Tripadvisor and the reasonable price were the deciding factors in booking a room here.
reviews.title: Relaxed and up-market hotel
Great Hotel
reviews.text: I should explain that I'm the type of traveller who is rarely happy with the first (or sometimes second) room allocated by the check in staff: I'm a bit picky. From the moment we stepped into the lobby at the Sofitel I could tell that this place was going to be nice. The porters delivered our bags to the room almost immediately: tipping them wasn't the usual embarrassing experience those of us from the UK have to endure in US hotels. Reception staff were very pleasant - a welcome and unusual attribute in this city. Check-in took seconds.

reviews.title: Great place - a bit pricey!
reviews.text: The bedroom was on the 23rd floor. It was impeccably clean and a reasonable size, with a great heating / airconditioning system and a very quiet location. The room smelt clean as soon as we opened the door (unlike the room we stayed at a week earlier in the New York Hilton which smelt musty and smoky). The bathroom was spacious and well laid out (separate shower and bath), with nice touches like a freshly cut flower and a candle (with a handy pack of matches too).

Although two of us were in the room, the hotel only provided one bath robe and one bottle of water - although they had both of our names and gave us two keys. The bed was a bit on the small side, and I suspect that they assumed only one person was staying in the room.
reviews.title: Sofitel-Thumbs Up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 6 nights here for pre-Christmas shopping and sightseeing. We had stayed before in Sept 2009 and found the Sofitel to be (again) excellent. The location is faultless. The room was spacious and comfortable and clean (with an excellent bed), and soundproofing was great too.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very good - reception, concierge, cleaning, bar and restaurant. If there was a minor fault, it would be that the bathroom can get a bit chilly.
reviews.title: Would stay again!

reviews.text: As a member of A-Club, got a 3 pm checkout - perfect for a 6 pm flight. Thank you.
reviews.title: Life is truly Magnifique here!

reviews.text: Overall, we would go back in a heartbeat - indeed, when we next go to New York, this is certainly where we'll stay unless we fancy a completely different part of town. For midtown, Sofitel is wonderful.
reviews.title: Back again to a midtown haven of excellence .
tried so many, This stay was perfect! Strongly Recommend
reviews.text: (Our package didn't include breakfast. Last time, we mostly went to The Red Flame on the same block. Mistake! This time we crossed 6th Avenue to have breakfast at either Saju or Un Deux Trois - the former slightly better but both absolutely worth that extra 100 yards walk and a couple of dollars more. For a real breakfast treat, grab a cab to downtown and Balthazar on Spring Street.)
I can only agree with the previous positive reviews. We've stayed in the Sofitel for 10 night and it was just perfect in every way.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Wonderful experience, even with some glitches
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and very quiet, we never heard any noise coming from the hallway or the other rooms. The bathroom was wonderfull, very clean, large and it was nice to take a relaxing bath (with little candle provided by the hotel) in the evening. The entire hotel is beautifully decorated, very tasteful!

reviews.title: Well worth the money
reviews.text: The location is suberb, 10mins walk to Times Square, Fifth Av just around the corner, 15mins walk to the Empire State Building, perfect for visiting the city. It was great to walk into the calm lobby after a long day of visiting the city. I've never had to wait for an elevator so it didnt bother me at all that there was no airco in the hallway.

reviews.title: Best Beds
reviews.text: We only dined in the hotel once since there are so many great restaurants in NY. For breakfast we went to the Red Flame (at the corner of 6th Av).

reviews.title: A must stay and must come back
reviews.text: I'm definitely coming back to this hotel!

I can simply say that anytime we return to NYC, this is where we will stay. I cannot imagine a better hotel for: location (peacefully quiet and only a 2 block walk down 44th and you are in Times Sq), ammenities (imagine a large king bedroom with perfect A/C, a good sized bathroom with seperate bath and shower and great toiletries and this in NYC?), staff (always friendly and polite with a ready smile), facilities (4 elevators and our maximum wait was about 15 seconds!!!, quiet bar/lounge, plenty of quality umbrellas for use).
reviews.title: The most perfect hotel in NYC - location,charm,amenities
Unforgettable stay
reviews.text: We arrived on the red-eye from San Francisco at 6:00 am on Sunday morning and were at the hotel by 7:00 am. Although room checkin is usually 3:00 pm and the hotel was FULL the previous night, they were able to get us a room by midday.

I recommend breakfast each day 3 doors down at The Red Flame diner - cheap but nice and not rushed. We didn't use the hotel restaurant for eating, though we had a couple of night cap cocktails that were nice and not overly expensive (I do recommend the 8th floor lounge at the Marriott on Times Sq for cocktails and Tapas).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Midtown Location, French Themed

reviews.text: Cabs are convenient because they are EVERYWHERE however a cheaper alternative is the subway. The nearest subway entry is 42nd and 5th - 3 streets down - a great/safe way to explore the city for $7 a day jumping on and off as often as you like. Greyline bus tours is located on 46th and 8th - again a short walk.
reviews.title: C'est tres tres bon!!!!!!!!!
Fab hotel, loved the rooms, perfect girly break!
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was fab. Location perfect and staff v.attentive and helpful.

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel in the heart of New York
reviews.text: They checked us in early after a long flight which was very welcome. I explained that my friend had not visited the city before and they gave us a room with great views of the city so she could take it all in. Our room was spotless and replenished daily. The hotel was the perfect base for our girls holiday. I'll definitely take my partner to stay here next time we're in the city.

reviews.title: Perfection !
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in the center of New York.

reviews.title: Would not change one thing
reviews.text: It´s near the Times Square and the 5th Avenue.

reviews.title: A Quiet Haven in The Big Apple
reviews.text: Quiet, Romantic and very Chic Hotel.

The first thing you notice when you step in to the lobby of the Sofitel New York is the silence: no car horns, no sirens, no sounds of the city whatsoever. Whoever designed the soundproofing for this building deserves some sort of award. Of all the hotels I have visited in Manhattan (quite a few), I have never experienced such a quiet room.
reviews.title: I have never stayed in such a quiet hotel room!
Loved it!!!!
reviews.text: We had reserved a queen room; the hotel very kindly upgraded us to a king, as we were celebrating our anniversary. By New York hotel standards the room was very spacious, but the bathroom was immense! There was a separate tub and a separate large shower. My wife raved about the personal products that were provided; she finally realized she remembered the soap from staying at the Sofitel in Paris over twenty years ago! I guess Sofitel finds something that works and stays with it.

reviews.title: Almost Perfect
reviews.text: As others have commented, the bed was extraordinary. The housekeeping staff was never seen, yet our room was always spotless, even if we left for a short time. The entire hotel staff was very attentive to any need that arose. I can't imagine a better hotel experience. And I haven't even mentioned the location: close to Times Square and theaters, close to the subway, no wait for a taxi. Rockefeller Center, the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building are all a short walk (a few blocks) away.
We didn't visit Gaby (the restaurant), so I cannot comment on that; we did, however, order room service for breakfast one morning, which was fine.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: The only remotely negative comment I can make is the room had no hair dryer when we arrived. We called downstairs and someone was there in less than five minutes with a replacement and extensive apologies. He seemed genuinely astonished that the hair dryer had been removed.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel!

reviews.text: My fiance and I got engaged in New York last September and stayed at a different hotel over in Murray Hill which was great if a little old. However, we were coming back to the city (to buy wedding rings this time!) and we wanted to stay somewhere different, so I checked out the Sofitel, was very impressed with the reviews on this site and booked it.
reviews.title: Best by far!!!
Marvellous, Marvellous, Marvellous !!
reviews.text: We stayed there from 5-8th March and it was simply the best hotel that either myself or my fiance had ever stayed in (and we've stayed in A LOT of hotels!). There is no way that this is a 4 star hotel - its 5 star all the way, from the impressive lobby, to the courteous staff, to the fantastic bedrooms.

reviews.title: Sofitel Hotel
reviews.text: I was totally thrilled from the minute we walked in, we requested a room with a view and were given a room on 21st floor - no problem, the bathroom was absolutely fabulous, the room spacious and spotless. We even had the maid come in again at night to turn down our bed, and leave a bottle of mineral water with the weather forecast for the next day!

reviews.title: Fab!! Fab!! Fab!!
reviews.text: I can't rate this hotel enough, its in a great location between 5th and 6th Avenues, 2 blocks from Times Square and close to many great attractions and stores. Definitely sign up for the Sofitel Privelege card, worth it for the late check out alone. Also the restaurant in the hotel (Gaby's) is top class and well worth a visit.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: We would not stay anyway else in New York now!

reviews.title: 5* reviews here are no exaggeration
reviews.text: My wife and I chose the Sofitel as the hotel for our first visit to New York on the basis of the reports here on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is quite simply superb. We booked a superior with a Queen sized bed on the 23rd floor overlooking the Chrysler Building and the room was incredibly comfortable. Everything you’ve read about the beds here is true. I reckon this was the most comfortable bed I’ve slept in anywhere in the world, and I’m pretty well travelled! The bathroom was elegant, and spacious, although the bath itself was too small, but the shower cubicle was more than fine. Being so high up there was zero noise from the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our wedding anniversary and we had champagne on ice delivered to our room gratis, not one evening but twice! Evening room service included two small bottles of Evian and a small box of chocolates.
reviews.title: Fills expectations - single night visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was excellent but expensive, as was the bar and restaurant downstairs.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone on here has mentioned, the Red Flame diner a few feet down on the left is an absolute gem. A real taste of New York, with lightning fast service, huge menu, open 6am til midnight, and cheap as chips.
reviews.title: OK not brilliant

reviews.text: The Sofitel position is perfect, five minutes from Times Square, Grand Central Station, etc.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings, My expectations where too high.
What could we have done to make your stay more enjoyable
reviews.text: "What could we have done to make your stay more enjoyable" - this was the key question of the Sofitel N.A. survey we found in our inbox returning home from a 6-nights stay at Sofitel N.Y. And indeed we had to leave the answer blank as nothing came to our mind. Thanks to all Sofitel employees that contributed to make our N.Y.C. experience enjoyable !

We have chosen Sofitel based on the positive reviews on Tripadvisor - thanks to all that have taken their time to report on Tripadvisor allowing others to take advantage of their experience and putting pressure on service providers to all travellers benefit !
reviews.title: The Wonderful Sofitel
Fabulous hotel!
reviews.text: Previous reports have given detailed descriptions - we wish to add some elements we found important with regard to our stay:

reviews.title: Join the Club!
reviews.text: 1. We have done the booking at the lowest available internet rate with full advance payment and no cancellation option. As we were sure about our dates with international flights confirmed and with a private trip insurance in case of Force Majeure, we found this option attractive and it worked out well.

2. We have acquired a Sofitel Priviledge card through the Sofitel website giving points towards a free stay and enjoyed a free drink of our choice during our stay and late check-out until 4 PM which was just perfect in light of the early evening flights to Europe.
reviews.title: Excellent !!!
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: We had only 2 nights in New York City and were grateful we picked this hotel because of its wonderful location. The rooms were compact but comfortable and all the staff we encountered were polite and obliging.

reviews.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
reviews.text: Friendly personal, clean and cozy room, perfect location - everything you might need in New York.

reviews.title: Comfort, space, peace & quiet, great location, great gym.
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in April in standard room, it was spacious, quite and comfortable with a very high standard of maintenance and cleanliness. The atmosphere of the Sofitel is pleasant and welcoming and the staff in general are very helpful. Concierge pointed us in the direction of some great local eateries for breakfast/lunch dinner. We used the gym each moring and it is very well equipped and we enjoyed it. Had breakfast in the hotel on one occasion and it was very expensive, there are much better and less expensive places nearby. We felt safe/secure coming and going from the Sofitel and would highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Wonderful service
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights in March. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge desk was particularly helpful, recommending restaurants, booking tickets and giving general advice cheerfully. There was a lot of rain during our stay in New York and our room had some water leaking in under the carpet. Unfortunately the next room we were sent to had the same problem. The staff were very apologetic and moved us into a suite. This was most unexpected and certainly not necessary as we were not really inconvenienced in our other rooms. We left the hotel feeling like special guests and would recommend it to anyone for a hassle free holiday.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This is hotel owned by a French company and catering to French and European travellers. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We find duvets annoying and our request for a top sheet after our first night was promptly taken care of. The conceierge was very helpful, the fitness facility top notch but the restaurant overpriced. IThe hotel is in the heart of the Broadway district and close to Bryant park. If you confortable with the NYC subway, it's a couple of blocks to Grand Central (Lex Ave lines) and 42nd Street (west side lines). Getting a taxi, despite the best efforts of the doorman, can take several minutes. Ignore other comments on the nearby Red Flame diner..just an ordinary diner, nothing excitiong. But the Taverna Kellinari, a Greek resturant, a couple of doors down was terrific; very good food and very lively and fun atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time in New York City and the Sofitel was excellent and worth every penny! The room, the service and the food was great! I would definitely recommend this hotel. We stayed for four nights and it was the best time ever. The hotel is in walking distance to many things, such as NBC Studios, Rockefeller plaza, Times Square and so on. Plus, it is located in a quiet area. I also enjoyed the Red Flame restaurant that was basically right next door. The food was great! We had breakfast twice there and our bill was no more than $25.00. We saw the play Grease and it was great! I plan to revisit New York City and stay at the Sofitel again.
reviews.title: Sofitel is Excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As Sofitel priviledge members we always stay at Sofitel Hotels where possible and the reviews on TripAdvisor for the New York Hotel were very good so we booked in for four nights.
reviews.title: Central Location

likes.disliked: — The size of the beds, next time we should book a King Size as their Queen size are very small

reviews.title: Top choice in New York!
reviews.text: Central location and friendly staff on arrival, we were not upgraded as there were no rooms available and our room was on the 15th floor but with views over the back of buildings and fire stairs on New York, not what we had requested. The room was a standard size but we had requested a Queen size bed and it was a double. The bathroom was a good size and had all the necessities. The next morning we went down to the front desk to see if we could get our upgrade or at least a room with a better view of New York and a Queen Size bed. Apparently in New York Queen size beds are what we in Australia call double, so remember this and book your bed accordingly. We were moved to a room on the 19th floor with a better view, same size bed and so we settled for the rest of our stay. Like all Sofitels complimentary water provided each afternoon/early evening and also free internet (with a printer) again appreciated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly, in particular the wonderful concergie and also William the doorman who organised a great town car to take us to the airport and who was always interested in how our days had been . The bar was nice and overall a good stay.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: Great little bar across the road fron the hotel - cant recall the name but good pasta and buffalo wings, you turn left as if going to fifth Street and its across the road. Also their is a post office across the road in an office building which is very close, ask William for instructions.. Also took the advice of other TripAdvisers and had breakfast each day at the little red dinner down the road, great breakfasts, good service and reasonable prices.
reviews.title: The pillows are heavenly!

likes.liked: — The bed - especially the pillows and the duvet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Sofitel and enjoyed it. We stayed in room 2021, the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom had a large shower. The only down side was that we booked a smoking room and had that confirmed in an email but when we arrived no smoking rooms were available so they said that although our room was officially non smoking they would send us up an ashtray, and despite that and also asking the chambermaid twice, no ashtray ever arrived over the 4 days that we stayed but it did not detract from our stay.
reviews.title: Ideal base in New York

likes.disliked: — The prices at the bar for drinks

reviews.text: As others have said the hotel is in a great location being only 2 blocks from Broadway. As we were only on the 20th floor we overlooked the roofs and back walls of other hotels but did have a great view of the Chrysler Building which looks brilliant at night when it is lit up.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel and Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others have mentioned the Red Flame diner as being good, the food is very good and it is only about 100 yards from the hotel, turn right when leaving the hotel.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another good place for breakfast is Ellens Starlight Diner on Broadway, about 51st Street and Broadway I think.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great service

likes.liked: — The comfy bed and excellent service

reviews.text: For dinner and drinks try the St Andrews bar, again turn right when leaving the hotel and it is 1 block down and on the left, the food is very good and they have English beers on tap and a mind boggling array of whiskey.
reviews.title: Nothing to fault

likes.liked: — Everything worked, no service problems, good location

reviews.text: My wife & I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sofitel (9th - 13th March '05). Our decision on booking this hotel was primarily based upon TripAdvisor reviews and I'm glad to say the good reviews are accurate.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Excellent location

reviews.text: All I can say it awesom!!!! I wouldnt stay anywhere else
reviews.title: Best customer service ever
Fantastic!
reviews.text: Excellent location and the best beds ever! Loved the Sofitel it was a fab sanctuary at the end of a tiring sight seeing/shopping day. The shower was lovely and the service also. The hotels location meant that it was possible to walk to nearly all popular attractions and the room service in a morning was always exactly on time! Never saw any of the maids but our room was kept spotless. Will definately stay here again when in NY.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel !!!!
reviews.text: Great location, between Times Square and 5th Avenue. I booked a luxury room at $610/night for 7 nights directly with my credit card, but I had also a sofitel favourite guest card ($300) that offers 50% discount Fri-Sun and 25% Mon-Thur. There was a problem at check-in with my favourite guest card, and they solved it immediately presenting their excuses by offering me 50% discount for the entire stay. They really have an aggressive commercial attitude, prefering to lose some money than have unsatisfied customers.

The hotel is excellent, the location is excellent, inside and outside noises are non-existent (excellent noise isolation, each floor only has 6-7 rooms), the staff is helpful, the room is clean (they clean it twice a day), marble bathroom, free evian water every night... This list could be endless, so I really recommend this hotel if you really want your stay in NYC to be excellent.
reviews.title: Surely the best hotel in midtown new york
Great Stay
reviews.text: The 14 hour days lugging yourself round new york deserves a reward and that reawrd can be a stay at the sofitel hotel. So near to Time Square and Grand Central and yet so far from the madding crowds. Just step into the lobby and the peaceful and serene setting immediately relaxes the mind. Or if you want to use the free aceess computers to check your emails, or step down to the fitness centre to exhaust those last few ounces of energy out of your system. Every member of staff meets and greets with sincerity and you make your way through spotless corridors and up polished lifts. Then enter your room (ours was a queen bed room on the 18th floor overlooking 46th st) Absolute silence and air conditioned. A super marble bathroom with roger gallet toiletries and a seperate walk in shower for me while the goood lady bathed in the seperate bath. And yet we still have not come to the best bit - The Bed, I have never slept in a more comfortable bed in all my travels, It is soooo comfortable and refreshed every day with crisp White linen as though it had just been un wrapped for the first time. A turn down service and bottles of evian just made it even more acceptable. Room service food was excellent if a little pricey but this IS new york and the quality of the food was more than satisfactory. If you want NEW YORK 24/7 this may not be the your option, but if your a seasoned traveller who likes to explore but also values a good nights rest then this may be the place for. My next Visit to New york will be at The sofitel.

My girlfriend and I stayed at Sofitel on July 23rd and 24th during a quick little getaway to NYC. Most personnel were quite friendly and accomodating, the lobby is quite nice, and I appreciated the free internet room off the lobby. One very annoying detail was the Lack of Air Conditioning In The Hotel Hallway! If I am being naive, please tell me, but I have travelled all over the world and stayed in a great many hotels. Never have I paid $300 and had to sweat while waiting for the elevator - NYC was in the mid-90's during our stay. Bizarre, but the couple from Boca in the room next door (who apparently paid close to $600 for a room that was just a tad larger) were neither shocked nor put off by this. Whatever. Workout room is decent, no pool, no jacuzzi, no sauna. Concierge is a passive aggressive guy who does things sequentially and slowly. Bell staff were quite nice. large stain in carpet in the room (pretty unacceptable even to rent a room with this problem, I feel, but the bell guy offered us another room, which we declined. bathroom clean, room otherwise pretty nice, but small. I did use my privelige card and got a 4pm checkout, as well as a small box of chocolates and 2 bottles of evian - nobody said anything about the free drink at the bar, which is promised, and I didn't ask. I was told by the older couple that I got a great deal (259 I think, plus a boatload of tax), and I guess I did okay. I like being wowed, though. Maybe you can't do that in New York for these prices, however.
reviews.title: Good, but far from Wow

reviews.text: One block from Broadway on 44th street, next to Iroquois and Algonquin where we stayed on previous trips. Rooms are nicely decorated, good sized with a large bathroom, and generally lower prices than the others. Three couples traveled together and paid three different prices ($229, $259 and $279) for the same room. Great lobby to wait for that one couple who is always late. Staff nice and very helpful. If you get the lower price, it is a "best buy" for the area, but better rooms regardless.
reviews.title: Best on Street

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Sofitel for our 10th anniversary and we were extremely satisfied with the hotel. After reading some of the not-so-hot recent reviews, we were worried. Not to worry...everything was perfect with Sofitel.
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.text: Before we arrived, we asked for early check-in and a high-floor room. When we arrived at noon, a room on the 22nd floor was waiting for us. However, because there were no Executive King Suites at the time we booked directly with the hotel, we asked if they had any cancellations since our booking and if so, could we upgrade to one from our Premier Queen room. They found a King on the 20th floor that we had to wait for but we didn't mind since it would be free of charge. We later found out that they had moved us without a fuss, even though they had already set up champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries in the first room. The champagne was a nice touch from the hotel and the strawberries were sent from a friend.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel

reviews.text: When we got into our room, we had a nice view to the side of the Chrysler Building and could see part of the top of the Empire State Builidng. The room was nicely decorated, not too modern and none of the furniture was shabby (as one past reviewer mentioned). The room was fairly big for a hotel room in a big city and the carpet looked and felt clean even walking on it barefooted. Strangely though, the room was not a suite even though the bed was a king bed. We had assumed that it would be a suite with it's own sitting room since a past reviewer had mentioned that the only way to get a king bed was to book a suite. I don't think that's the case now. The bed was absolutely comfortable!!! I like firm beds and my husband likes softer beds. For some reason, we BOTH had no problems sleeping in comfort on this bed.
reviews.title: Great, Service, Great Room, Great Choice
Good, but a little overrated
reviews.text: Definitely a solid hotel, but based on the glowing reviews I saw here, I thought I was in for the hotel stay of my lifetime. The queen deluxe room was a good size, not huge, like at the Affinia Dumont (my favorite NY hotel, but a little pricey these days), but nice enough. The bathroom was wonderful, large with a bath AND shower. Overall, the staff was helpful, my room was ready by 10am, but I did have to call down three times for some extra toothpaste. Be warned that your Sofitel privilege card will not be honored if you book your room online at a discounted rate. Nice place, above average but not excellent.
Booked the Sofitel for a bargain price of £364 on airline-network.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at an excellent price

reviews.text: We were given a lovely king room, gorgeous bed, decor and bathroom. The room was just lovely after a long flight from Heathrow.
reviews.title: The most comfortable bed in NYC

reviews.text: The reception staff always said hello or mostly "bonjour!" The location
reviews.title: Great hotel!
Excellent Service, Excellent Value
reviews.text: was perfect, close enough to Times Square and 6th Avenue for some fun but quiet enough for some peace!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Sofitel between Thanksgiving and 1 December. We'd previously stayed here in 2002 and I am seriously impressed that the quality of both the accommodations and the service at this hotel has not noticably diminished with time. We arrived at around 2.30pm and our room was already available - we were upgraded to a suite on the 29th floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building and Bryant Park 1
reviews.title: Wow - still an oasis of understated luxury

likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee making facilities in room

reviews.text: Check in was super friendly and welcoming - our stay could not have got off to a better start. The suite was just as I remembered- - clean, spacious, comfortable and very VERY quiet. We never heard another guest during our entire stay. Bathroom amenities include a power shower with fantastic water pressure, a soaking tub and other little touches including robes, huge fluffy towels, slippers and Roger & Gallet Oatmeal toiletries(excellent for those with sensitive skin - not too perfumed). Room service was excellent as was the housekeeping - everything was replenished daily and extras always left. We had fresh flowers in our bedroom (orchids) and a single orchid in the bathroom. The turn down service left a box of chocolates and bottles of water every evening. We didn't use the hotel restaurant or bar as we were out and about a lot so I cannot comment on these facilities. There is a mini bar in the room and the prices weren't too outrageous by big city standards - however it would still be nice to have tea and coffee making facilities for first thing in the morning...
reviews.title: Tranquility in the middle of Manhattan at the Sofitel

likes.liked: — location, fanststic views, clean, helpful staff
likes.disliked: — very expensive to eat and drink there

reviews.text: On the day of our departure I asked for a late check-out which was granted "with pleasure" (I asked for 4.00pm - although we actually left at 3.00pm) There was a slight problem with my bill at check out but this was modified immediately with apologies from the staff. The concierge and the door men offered umbrellas and assistance when it rained and were able to call a cab to the airport without delay - great service and always with asmile.
reviews.title: Fabulous comfy beds!

likes.disliked: — No tea making facilities, but understand this is normal in most US hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would categorise this hotel as understated luxury - quiet,efficient and charming. The Staff go out of their way to be both welcoming and helpful. Add to that the brilliant location and I don't think you can get a better deal in this city.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel !

likes.liked: — Comfortable and clean rooms - location was fantastic!
likes.disliked: — Noisy lifts and room too hot at times - but these are MINOR concerns

reviews.text: We arrived at the Sofitel New York on Christmas Eve for our first trip to the city. I was pleasently suprised by the exterior, as websites show a new, tall. glass building, however the entrance is the original Edwardian facade, as are the lobby and reception area, all of which were beautifully decorated for Christmas. It is only after you exit from the lift that you realize you are in a new 'tower' building.
reviews.title: Metti Made the Experience Unique
Great place to stay
reviews.text: This is a top hotel. Great service and comfortable surroundings. Great location. Easy to walk to Times Square.

reviews.title: still a great hotel
reviews.text: This is a really late review that I've been meaning to write. My husband and I traveled to NYC a second time back in Sept. of last year. It was our second stay at the Sofitel b/c we were so impressed during our first day. We had a lower floor room and had a fairly quiet stay. I say fairly b/c there was a group of women who loved to step out into the narrow hallway and talk loudly all the time. It was rather annoying. I'm a woman with little patience so I asked to be moved to another floor since you really can't force people to be quieter. Our request was granted and we had a great stay for the remainder for our trip. We plan on another trip this year to NYC and we will be staying there again. The hotel is in a great location and the staff there are wonderful.

reviews.title: I love Sofitel
reviews.text: I travel to New York for both Business and pleasure about every two weeks. This trip was a combination of both. Usually when I travel I stay at Starwood hotels and have stayed at the Westin and almost every W hotel in New York. I have also stayed in the Mrriot Marquis, the Millineum, the Plaza, the Four Seasons, several modern boutique hotels and some other 4 and 5 star hotels over the years. This trip was during fleet week so the hotel I wanted to stay in was booked. Since I had stayed at my first Sofitel in Philadelphia recently and had a good experience (they gave us a suite for the standard rate because all of their standard rooms were booked) I booked the New York Sofitel through Perfect Escapes. I booked a standard queen room that came with a guaranteed upgrade (upon availability), early check in, late check out, and free breakfast.

reviews.title: Fabulous for a romantic getaway
reviews.text: I arrived at around 1 pm and they checked me right in to a large suite on the 26th floor (not a junior suite) which had a great view of the Chrysler building and where a welcome card awaited me. The room was really nice, had plenty of closet space, and was very quiet. Everything was really clean, no foul smells, and no wear and tear was apparent. I love the Sofitel feather beds and our bed had both down and synthetic pillows already on it. At turn down we were left with a large glass bottle of Evian and two small plastic bottles in addition to a box of chocolates. The towels were replaced, the music was turned on, the drapes were closed in both the living room and the bedroom, and certain lights were turned on. The bathroom had a fresh orchid and candles for around the tub. The water pressure in our room was really good so I cannot explain why others have had problems with it.

reviews.title: Made my 30th birthday Heaven
reviews.text: Room service was fast and efficient and not anymore expensive than I had paid elsewhere. The concierge was polite and helpful and our wake up calls were exactly as requested, I do not care that it was a recording. The gym was small but well equipped. I ALWAYS put my valuables in the safe (which this room was equipped with) and would not leave money unsecured in a hotel room.
