It doesn't matter the class of the hotel, thefts occur everywhere, so I did not have any issues with items missing from our room.

reviews.title: The Best
reviews.text: I travelled to New York for the second Christmas in a row and stayed here again! I was a bit concerned that it would live up to my memory of last year as this time I'd brought my mum and sister.

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.text: I had no need to worry as they both loved it.

reviews.title: Sorry, another brilliant review!
reviews.text: Again we found it well worth the cost.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: I would highly recommend you stay here.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location
reviews.text: The food, service and rooms are all excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really surprised to find a package deal on Expedia that included a hotel ranked (by Tripadvisor) as third in New York.
reviews.title: Great for a first timer to NYC

likes.liked: — Location - it is in a perfect place for any tourist!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Decent location and bed, the rest...

reviews.text: (1) The location is absolutely superb. You capture the essence of NYC as you are jammed between 5th Ave and Broadway - Times Square is two blocks away.
reviews.title: great location; not bowled over by hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (2) The gym is great, with plenty of machines, free weights and towels. Another good feature of the gym is that it is open 24/7 via the swipe access card used for your room.
reviews.title: Better than best review

likes.liked: — Comfort and ability to walk everywhere

reviews.text: (3) The bed is awesome, and there is lots of warmth in the room with controllable heating / air conditioning. I did appreciate a window that opened as well, as sometimes the cleaning staff sprayed an awful 'air freshener' that made the room smell stale and off.
reviews.title: the best hotel in nyc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good stay with such a great location. I do feel the staff could be more polite esp when we are paying so much. Rooms were nice and didn't notice the excess noise others have complained about.
reviews.title: Good but service could be friendlier

reviews.text: I have just returned from a long weekend in NY. This was my first visit to NY and I was really pleased that we stayed at the Sofitel. The location was fantastic, between 5th and 6th Avenue, just a short stroll from Time Square. We were on a girlie shopping break, so booked a twin room. The room was of a reasonable size and the beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. I have no complaints whatsoever. There is an iron/ironing board in the room and a good hairdryer. No tea/coffee making facilities, but maybe that's a British thing. Anyway, we found a Starbucks nearby on 5th Ave for an early coffee! There is complimentary Evian water in the room.
reviews.title: Fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't eat or drink in the hotel, but the restaurant seemed very popular with large groups of people.
reviews.title: Comfort in the city

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful. We left our luggage at the hotel after we checked out and when we returned 6 hours later, we were able to weigh our cases to make sure that we weren't over the 23kg limit!
reviews.title: Never disappoints

reviews.text: There are 3 computers in a little room off the lobby with free internet and a printer. We never had a problem with availability. There is Wi-Fi in the room, but there is a charge.
reviews.title: Seriously overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a stay at the Sofitel for our 25th anniversary and my sister's 15th, after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. What can I say? All the plaudits are well-deserved. Really nice ambience, friendly staff, complimentary champagne for our anniversaries - superb! Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Best NY hotel I've stayed in!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel a couple of days ago based purely on the other trip advisor reviews (it's rated no.1) as we wanted a change from the 'trendy' hotel scene (the Ws, the tribeca grand etc). It's a great location (few blocks from time Square) but not noisy or that busy which makes a change.
reviews.title: Diffiuclt to find fault but....

likes.disliked: — Did not fix the air con in one room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in town about 7.30 on Saturday evening and booking in was very easy as our rooms were pre-booked through Expedia and there was no line up. The rooms were reasonably spacious (by NY standards) and did not look at all tired/dated and the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms were also a decent size and were very clean. The rooms have internet connection (at $10 for 24 hours) but you can use the net for free in the lobby as there were 3 computers.
reviews.title: Amazing!

likes.disliked: — next time I'll try to get a king size bed (if it is not too expensive)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the hotel was also very good (which makes a change) but like most other hotels a little expensive. We were also given an extended checkout (2pm, which they let us extend to 5pm at no extra cost).
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Beds, Great place to stay!

likes.liked: — The Beds and the separate shower, Breakfast

reviews.title: Genuinly world class hotel
reviews.text: There was however one slight niggle- the air conditioning in one of the rooms did not work very well. Unfortunately they didn't seem to be able to fix it properly which was slightly annoying.

reviews.title: Excellent midtown hotel
reviews.text: An excellent New York midtown hotel. Certainly up to the high standards that we have come to expect from Sofitel. A perfect location. Walking distance to just about everything, including 2 or 3 different subway stops. The service was extremely good, including the front desk staff, the concierge and staff in the bar/restaurant. Overall, a very intimate larger hotel. The rooms were very nice. The bathroom was quite large and very beautifully decorated. The hotel, including the rooms, is very quiet. There was virtually no street noise to interfere with a good night's sleep. Very efficient air conditioning, even on a very hot day. One minor complaint - the standard rooms should have a king size bed, not a queen size. The rooms could easily handle the slightly larger bed. Overall, an extremely well located, designed and run hotel. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Sofitel New York in February, and wrote a review giving the hotel 5 stars for a perfect visit. Six months later, I would say the front desk service I received has cost them a star.
reviews.title: Service Drops a Star from Last Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I was happy. The room was clean and wonderfully quiet, the bed was great, and the room service we had one evening was lovely. We reserved the Chic Picnic deal that got us one free night out of 4, and a lovely picnic basket filled with gourmet sandwiches, salads, fresh fruit, and home-baked cookies, and a bottle of Champagne. It was fabulous, as was our "welcome" cocktail and the late checkout. The problem was, we had to ask for these things, when they should have been mentioned at check in. I presented my Sofitel Privilege card, which should be enough to get the conversation started about the welcome cocktails and the late checkout. I booked the Chic Picnic package, which should have meant that the staff would ask us when we'd like it. I ended up feeling like I was groveling for freebies, which should not have been the case.
reviews.title: excellent time

likes.disliked: — breakfast dinning room was too small - food was good though

reviews.text: So, overall, things were great, but I felt sort of awkward with regard to the front desk. I'm not sure if my next trip will find me at Sofitel or not, but I must say if you are a light sleeper, this is the place for you. I cannot believe how quiet the room was- no street noise at all!
reviews.title: very good hotel

likes.liked: — The staff service and the dimension of the room
likes.disliked: — The lack of a free internet connection in the room

reviews.text: Stayed here for a wedding anniversary and booked a deluxe room. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite on the top floor which was very nice. A good start to any trip.
reviews.title: OVERATED!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel!!
reviews.title: The best start to your New York experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Sofitel after many hours trawling through New York Hotels on trip advisor. I am so glad that we chose the Sofitel as it was such a lovely hotel. It is definately 4-5 star and the rooms are replenished and cleaned every day, great classy facilities and the staff are all polite and most helpful. Gaby's bar & restaurant are really nice if a little expensive, however you expect that from this kind of hotel. DO NOT USE MINI BAR! $6 for a bottle of water! You get 2 free bottles of Evian every evening anyway and a weather report card.
reviews.title: Superb stay - read on...

likes.liked: — The staff and the overall feeling of quality
likes.disliked: — The balcony was a bit sparse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the most amazing weather for this time of year - 70-80 degrees throughout stay. First 2 weeks of October are great for New York city as there are a couple of parades on 5th avenue where you might spot a few stars. It all starts on 44th so you get to see the beginning of the parades without even leaving hotel!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, Great Location

likes.liked: — High quality but not oversized hotel

reviews.text: Jimmys bar is only across the way and is a great little bar to go to.
reviews.title: Nothing Special!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our best reccommendation for seeing New York for the first time is to get on a Grey Line sight seeing open top bus. You get great info from the guides and the best view of buildings and you can hop on and off as many times as you like. Cheap and value for money. Also I'd do the Top of the Rock before the Empire State for views as there are no queues and the views are great!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend

reviews.text: Arrived 2nd July and left on the 7th after the best week of my life.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay and DEFINITELY coming back

reviews.text: We had a fantastic suite with a huge (and I mean huge) terrace looking out at the GE, Chrysler and Empire State.
reviews.title: A great experience!

reviews.text: The room was spacious (by New York standards) with a very good bathroom (deep bath) and great shower with good products. The sitting room was also well appointed and led on to the terrace.
reviews.title: Suite at Sofitel
Simply the Best
reviews.text: The rooms were immaculate every day we were there and the service outstanding, particularly for my engagement proposal to my girlfriend! They kindly arranged for a rose petal trail to lead out to the terrace with waiting chocolates and champage. I will remember that moment for the rest of my life and the Sofitel made it special indeed.

reviews.title: tops in new york
reviews.text: Everything was arranged by the amazing lady who looks after the General Manager.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the sofitel in June 2004 for 9 nights. It was fantastic in everyway. The location was brilliant, the room was luxurious and large, and the staff were very helpful. I would recommed anyone going to NY to stay at this gem of a hotel.

reviews.title: Love the Sofitel
reviews.text: Let me begin by stating I travel a lot for business and am a bit of a hotel snob. NYC is my destination for playing once or twice a year and usually stay at the Sofitel. I have found you can find better rates on line than booking with the Sofitel direct. The rooms are clean, quiet, beautiful and well appointed and the bathroom is a nice size for NYC. The Concierge knows it all and is very helpful. My only complaint is the the front desk person, depending on who you get may be a bit snooty. Not a big deal.

reviews.title: Not Outstanding Reservation System
reviews.text: I went to book a room at this hotel because of all the great reviews. Their web site showed no Executive Suites available although Expedia did. So I called them and they said they were not sure why their web site was not showing available Executive Suites. They would however match Expedia's rate which just about every hotel will. However they would not guarantee me a high floor. They said I could call the day of to see if I got a high floor but since they gave me the cheap Expedia rate they would not guarantee me a high floor unless they had a room on a high floor the day I was to check in. Yes they gave me the Expedia rate but they didn't have to give Expedia a cut since I was booking through Sofitel and not Expedia and they didn't even show anything available on their site.

reviews.title: Ideal
reviews.text: In any event they were pleasant just seemed unorganized, not helpful and did not behave like an outstanding hotel.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We booked the Sofitel on the recommendation of all the people who had added reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel was in the middle of everything and we walked almost everywhere! All the staff were friendly and more than helpful, all of the tips and advice they gave us was spot on and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. We will defiantly be staying there when we return on future trips to New York.

aka: Sofitel New York Hotel New York City
description: The ultimate in comfort and convenience, this thirty-story building in midtown Manhattan-a contemporary statement in limestone and glass-is just a stone's throw from Fifth Avenue. The modern-day traveler will enjoy the amenities on offer at this fine establishment, set within easy reach of Manhattan's most celebrated attractions. These include Times Square, Broadway theaters, world-famous restaurants, famous boutiques, art museums and corporate headquarters. Good access to transportation links.
